topic.title: VLAN Settings
topic.shortdesc: VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network) is a group of hosts with a common set of requirements, which communicate as if they were attached to the same broadcast domain, regardless of their physical location.

body.p: A VLAN is a broadcast domain created by switches. This means the VLAN is configured on switches, layer 3 switches.

ul.li: Some of the switches donâ€™t support VLAN.
TA1600/2400/3200 acts as an VLAN client, a 3-layer switch is needed.
